questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Boolean algebra in digital circuit design?
options: To calculate financial budgets for chip manufacturing.
To simplify and analyze logic functions for circuit implementation.
To manage the physical placement of components on a chip.
To estimate the power consumption of a circuit.
To simulate the behavior of analog signals.

questions.question: In pipelined processors, what is the primary function of a pipeline register (or inter-stage buffer)?
options: To store the final result of an instruction after it has completed all stages.
To hold intermediate results and control signals between consecutive pipeline stages, separating them temporally.
To manage the allocation and deallocation of physical registers for register renaming.
To perform complex arithmetic and logical operations on data.
To buffer instructions that have been fetched from memory but are not yet decoded.

questions.question: What does the term 'process variation' primarily refer to in the context of semiconductor manufacturing?
options: The different types of manufacturing processes (e.g., CMOS, BiCMOS) available for chip fabrication.
Unintended deviations in manufacturing parameters (e.g., transistor dimensions, doping concentrations) that cause differences between nominally identical devices.
The ability of a CPU to switch between different execution modes (e.g., user mode, kernel mode).
Variations in the clock frequency of an integrated circuit due to temperature changes.
The different software compilation optimization levels used during development.

questions.question: Which type of memory is volatile, typically constructed using capacitors and transistors, and requires periodic refresh cycles to retain its data?
options: SRAM (Static Random-Access Memory)
ROM (Read-Only Memory)
NAND Flash Memory
DRAM (Dynamic Random-Access Memory)
EEPROM (Electrically Erasable Programmable Read-Only Memory)

questions.question: In a modern out-of-order execution processor, what is the primary role of the Reorder Buffer (ROB)?
options: To store the most recently used instruction addresses for branch prediction.
To provide a temporary buffer for instructions that have been fetched but not yet decoded.
To hold instructions that have completed execution out-of-order and ensure they are committed (retired) to the architectural state in original program order, handling precise exceptions.
To perform address translation from virtual to physical memory addresses.
To buffer data read from the data cache before it is written to a register.
